@mz__kev A few things most companies will look for in a dev looking to turn dev advocate:
1) ability to translate technical topics into easy-to-understand concepts
2) empathy for customers
3) involvement in open source projects or community events (meetups, conferences, etc.)

@mz__kev Absolutely! I'd look into companies that are adding Dev Advocates to their team rather than one that's building a Developer Relations team from scratch (aka you'd be a team of one). They'll be able to set you up for success to learn from other teammates who have more experience.

- If I _can't_ archive the articles in a separate list, I need to be able to sort by "untagged" articles to see which ones I still need to sift through for this week's issue.
